text: hey everyone I thought I'd show you
another use for this small pressure
chamber that I built
I carbonated some apple slices so let me
show you how that turned out
so in a previous video I used this
stainless steel water bottle with the
top that I made on the lathe it's just
sort of a convenient pressure vessel
with a valve on it so in this case I
have it hooked up to pure co2 and I
chopped up an apple off the tree outside
and put the apple slices in there and I
actually had it up to about 60 psi and
after a couple hours those apple slices
were pretty well carbonated it actually
worked out quick enough but in this case
I left it up at about 60 psi for about
two days so let's see how they turned
out now so too bad you can't hear this
movie you can yeah it sounds like a bowl
of a rice krispies here so it has been a
couple days so the apples have turned
slightly Brown just because there was a
little bit of oxygen left in the in the
chamber there let's see how it tastes
it's really quite good it's like a
apple-cider in a solid form almost it
has a very good sort of bite to it the
carbon or the carbonation produces
carbonic acid in your mouth which gives
cider that sort of bite and these are
green apples so they're already fairly
strong in flavor definitely a good easy
way to make fruit more interesting all
right see you next time bye
